title: 105_hr4046
content: Restrictions on transfers or discharges of nursing facility residents in case of voluntary withdrawal from Medicaid program. In case of a nursing facility voluntarily withdrawing from the Medicaid program, residents cannot be transferred or discharged solely based on the facility's withdrawal. Residents of a nursing facility cannot be transferred or discharged solely because the facility voluntarily withdraws from the Medicaid program. The provisions of this section apply to residents until their discharge, even if they started residing in the facility after the withdrawal. The nursing facility must provide notice to residents about their rights until discharge, including those who start residing after Medicaid withdrawal. The nursing facility must provide written information to new residents upon admission, separate from other documents, and obtain a signed acknowledgment of receipt. This does not affect the requirement for advance notice of termination to the State or Secretary. The nursing facility must provide written information to new residents upon admission, separate from other documents, including details about the facility's participation in the program and the possibility of transfer or discharge. The nursing facility can transfer or discharge a resident if they are unable to pay, even if they become eligible for medical assistance. Residents who become eligible for medical assistance for nursing facility services can continue to receive payments under the State plan even after the facility voluntarily withdraws from participation. Residents eligible for nursing facility services can still receive payments under the State plan after the facility voluntarily withdraws, ensuring compliance with all requirements and maintaining survey and enforcement authority. The provisions of this subparagraph apply to significant voluntary reductions in participation under a State plan for nursing facility services. The provisions of this subparagraph apply to a significant voluntary reduction in participation under a State plan for nursing facility services for residents entitled to medical assistance. The subparagraph applies to voluntary withdrawal of participation in nursing facility services for residents entitled to medical assistance. It does not apply to new residents starting after the withdrawal date. The effective date for this amendment is for withdrawals occurring after the enactment of the Act. A report on implementation is required within 5 years. The amendment applies to voluntary withdrawal from nursing facility services for residents receiving medical assistance, effective after the enactment of the Act. A report on the impact of the changes is required within 5 years. The report will analyze the effects of changes in Medicaid reimbursement rates on nursing facilities, including voluntary withdrawal from the program and recommendations for legislative changes.
